attributes.action: Nationalise all private healthcare providers to tackle COVID-19
attributes.additional_details: Following in the footprints of governments like Spain - the UK could acquire the equipment, beds and resources of private healthcare suppliers by nationalising them. This is a necessary step because the NHS is currently struggling to distribute limited hospital beds, ventilators and treatment resources for the rising wave of COVID-19 sufferers. Even before the arrival of COVID-19 the NHS has been under devastating strain after a decade of austerity and healthcare funding cuts. We must act now.
attributes.background: As we prepare for an exponential rise in cases of COVID-19 the NHS is underprepared after a decade of austerity. The government is currently renting private hospital beds for £2.4million a day. This is a waste of precious resources - nationalising private healthcare providers will save lives.
